definitions: unexpected difficulty or obstacle that causes a delay or interruption
knot used to temporarily secure a rope to an object or another rope
sudden jerky movement typically upward or forward in lifting or pulling
examples: The project went smoothly without a single hitch
We encountered a minor hitch with the delivery schedule
He tied a clove hitch around the post
The sailor secured the boat with a rolling hitch
She gave her backpack a hitch onto her shoulders
The horse moved forward with an awkward hitch

definitions: person who travels by getting free rides from passing vehicles
examples: The hitchhiker stood by the highway with his thumb out
She picked up a hitchhiker heading toward Seattle

definitions: professional assassin hired to kill someone for payment
examples: The crime thriller featured a retired hitman seeking redemption
Police discovered evidence linking him to a professional hitman

definitions: player who strikes the ball in baseball or similar sports
person who hits or strikes with force or skill
examples: The team's best hitter stepped up to the plate
She's a powerful hitter with excellent batting average
The boxer was known as a heavy hitter
He proved himself as a hard hitter in negotiations

definitions: act of forcefully making contact with something using hands or implements
examples: The hitting in today's hockey game was particularly aggressive
Baseball coaches focus heavily on hitting technique

definitions: structure where bees live and produce honey, either natural or artificial
place that is full of people working or moving busily
examples: The beekeeper inspected each hive for signs of disease
Wild bees built their hive in the old oak tree
The office was a hive of activity before the deadline
The market became a hive of excitement during festival season

definitions: large amount of something valuable that is kept hidden or stored secretly
examples: Archaeologists discovered an ancient hoard of gold coins
The dragon guarded its hoard of treasure jealously

definitions: practice of accumulating and storing excessive amounts of items or resources
large outdoor board used for displaying advertisements especially in British English
examples: His hoarding of old newspapers filled three rooms
Hoarding behavior often increases during economic uncertainty
The new movie was advertised on every hoarding in town
Construction site hoarding blocked the view of the building work

definitions: malicious deception or practical joke intended to trick people into believing something false
examples: The viral video turned out to be an elaborate hoax
Police warned residents about the telephone hoax

definitions: flat cooking surface on top of a stove with burners or heating elements
examples: She placed the kettle on the hob to boil water
The ceramic hob was easier to clean than gas burners

definitions: small humanlike creature with hairy feet from Tolkien's Middle-earth fantasy works
examples: Bilbo Baggins was the most famous hobbit in literature
The hobbits lived peacefully in the Shire

definitions: regular activity done for enjoyment during one's spare time
examples: Photography became her favorite hobby after retirement
He turned his hobby of woodworking into a small business

definitions: person who pursues a particular hobby or interest as recreation rather than profession
examples: The electronics hobbyist built his own radio from scratch
Model train hobbyists gathered for the annual convention

definitions: mischievous or evil sprite from folklore that causes trouble or frightens people
examples: The old tales spoke of hobgoblins haunting the forest
Shakespeare's Puck was a type of hobgoblin character

definitions: homeless person who travels from place to place, historically seeking work
examples: During the Depression, many hobos rode the rails looking for jobs
The hobo left his mark on the fence post

definitions: joint in the hind leg of a four-legged animal between knee and fetlock
state of being pawned or act of pawning something for money
examples: The veterinarian examined the horse's injured hock
The dog's hocks were well-formed and strong
He had to hock his watch to pay the rent
Most of his valuables were in hock at the pawnshop

definitions: fast-paced team sport played on ice or field with sticks and puck or ball
examples: The hockey team won the championship in overtime
She played field hockey throughout high school

definitions: long-handled tool with a flat blade used for breaking up soil and weeding
examples: She used a hoe to prepare the vegetable garden
The farmer sharpened his hoe before starting work

definitions: large domestic pig, especially one raised for meat production
person who takes more than their fair share of something selfishly
examples: The farmer raised hogs for the local market
The prize-winning hog weighed over 300 pounds
Don't be such a hog with the popcorn
He's a bandwidth hog downloading movies all day

definitions: mechanical device or apparatus used for lifting heavy loads vertically
examples: The engine hoist lifted the motor from the car
Workers operated the hoist to move construction materials

definitions: way of grasping or gripping something with hands or tools
large storage space in the lower part of a ship or aircraft
controlling influence or power maintained over something or someone
examples: She adjusted her hold on the tennis racket
The climber lost his hold on the rock face
The cargo hold was filled with containers
Passengers aren't allowed in the aircraft hold
The company maintains a strong hold on the market
The dictator's hold over the country finally weakened

definitions: person who owns or possesses something, especially legally or officially
device or container designed to hold or support something specific
examples: The ticket holder must present valid identification
Account holders received notice of the policy change
She placed her phone in the dashboard holder
The candle holder was made of brass

definitions: financial asset or investment owned by a person or organization
area of land owned or rented by someone for farming or development
examples: The company's holdings include several tech startups
Her stock holdings doubled in value last year
The family's land holdings stretched across three counties
Small holdings were common in the rural area

definitions: person who refuses to agree or comply when others have already done so
examples: He was the last holdout in the jury deliberations
Several holdouts refused to sign the new contract

definitions: person or thing that remains from a previous time, administration, or system
examples: The policy was a holdover from the previous administration
These traditions are holdovers from colonial times

definitions: opening or cavity in or through something solid
difficult or awkward situation that is hard to escape from
examples: The dog dug a hole in the backyard
There's a hole in my sock that needs mending
The company found itself in a financial hole
His lies dug him into a deeper hole

definitions: special day of celebration when many people are exempt from work
period of time spent away from home or work for rest and recreation
examples: Christmas is a major holiday in many countries
The bank will be closed for the national holiday
They spent their summer holiday touring Europe
She needs a holiday after working so hard

definitions: loud cry or shout typically expressing strong emotion or calling attention
examples: Give me a holler when you're ready to leave
We heard a holler from across the field

definitions: empty space or cavity within something solid
small valley or natural depression in the landscape
examples: The tree trunk had a large hollow where animals nested
Sound echoed in the hollow of the cave
They built their cabin in a peaceful mountain hollow
Mist gathered in the hollow between the hills

definitions: evergreen shrub or tree with glossy leaves and bright red berries
examples: They decorated the house with holly for Christmas
The holly bush provided shelter for small birds

definitions: tall ornamental plant with large colorful flowers growing along upright stems
examples: Hollyhocks grew against the cottage wall
She planted pink and white hollyhocks in her garden

definitions: destruction or slaughter on a mass scale, especially by fire
systematic mass murder of Jewish people by Nazi Germany during World War II
examples: Nuclear war would result in a global holocaust
Environmental activists warned of an ecological holocaust
Holocaust survivors shared their stories with students
The Holocaust Museum preserves memory of the victims

definitions: three-dimensional image created by laser light that appears to float in space
examples: The credit card featured a security hologram
Scientists created a hologram of the artifact for display

definitions: technique of creating three-dimensional images using laser light interference patterns
examples: Holography has applications in data storage and security
Medical holography helps visualize complex anatomical structures

definitions: leather or synthetic case for carrying a handgun or tool on the body
examples: The officer drew his weapon from the holster
She wore a shoulder holster under her jacket

definitions: quality of being dedicated to God or deserving spiritual respect and reverence
examples: The holy shrine attracted thousands of pilgrims
They observed the holy day with prayer and fasting

definitions: special honor or respect shown publicly to someone or something worthy
examples: The film was an homage to classic noir cinema
Artists paid homage to the master painter

definitions: informal term for a man or fellow, especially in Western or Spanish contexts
examples: That hombre knows how to handle horses
He's one tough hombre who never backs down

definitions: beer or other alcoholic drink made at home rather than commercially
software or hardware developed by hobbyists outside commercial channels
examples: His homebrew won first prize at the craft beer festival
They sampled different homebrews at the tasting party
The homebrew operating system gained a dedicated following
Hobbyists shared their homebrew games online

definitions: return to one's home after time away, especially marked by celebration or ceremony
examples: The soldier's homecoming brought tears of joy
High school homecoming featured a parade and dance

definitions: country where a person was born or has strong ancestral and cultural ties
examples: Immigrants often miss their homeland deeply
She returned to her homeland after twenty years abroad

definitions: person who manages a household as their primary occupation, especially caring for family
examples: She chose to be a homemaker while her children were young
Modern homemakers often balance many complex responsibilities

definitions: system of alternative medicine using highly diluted substances to treat illness
examples: She consulted a practitioner of homeopathy for her allergies
Homeopathy remains controversial in mainstream medicine

definitions: person who owns the house or apartment in which they live
examples: Homeowners received a tax credit for energy improvements
The homeowner filed an insurance claim after the storm

definitions: main or introductory page of a website that serves as starting point
examples: The company homepage features their latest products
Click the logo to return to the homepage

definitions: baseball hit that allows the batter to circle all bases and score
examples: He hit a homer in the bottom of the ninth inning
The slugger's homer cleared the center field wall

definitions: classroom where students meet at the beginning of each school day for attendance
examples: Students report to homeroom before first period
The homeroom teacher made daily announcements

definitions: house and surrounding land owned and occupied by a family as their home
examples: Their homestead included fifty acres of farmland
Pioneers established homesteads across the prairie

definitions: city or town where a person was born or grew up
examples: She returned to her hometown for the reunion
The athlete was honored by his hometown with a parade

definitions: academic work assigned to students to be completed outside regular class time
examples: She spent three hours on her math homework
The teacher collected homework at the beginning of class
